page.title: 05Canal interview,Bradford
page.content: The stretch of the{Leeds-Liverpool } {Canal}on which the man works is about 42 miles long.It stretches between Leeds and Barnoldswick. He told us that during the winter hardly any boats pass along the canal but between April and September there are about 6 or 7 boats each day.There are mainly{pleasure craft}on the canal.There is no commercial traffic. The canal has not been{dredged}for some years but they are beginning to dredge it once more.The more boats that use the canal the more damage is caused.There are about 40 men who work on that particular stretch of canal.Flooding is very rare.There is quite a lot of{fishing}as well as other activities,such as {canoeing}.The canal worker is based at{Apperley Bridge,}Bradford.
